quest.description_key: Cordage is usefull resource for crafting important survival gear like basic stone axe or plant fiber clothing. Gather the ingredients by attacking grass. Once you have the ingredients, access the Inventory and locate Cordage in the Resources category of the Crafting window.

Craft a Stone Axe to help you defend yourself and gather crafting ingredients. Gather the ingredients by attacking grass, stone, or wood objects. You can also pick up small stones by looking at them and using the Pickup action. Once you have the ingredients, access the Inventory and locate Stone Axe in the Basics category of the Crafting window.

Craft plant fiber clothing to protect you from damage and keep you warm in cold weather. Gather plant fibers by attacking grass. Once you have the ingredients, access the Inventory and locate the Clothing category of the Crafting window.

To wear your plant fiber clothing, access the Inventory and select an article of clothing, then select Wear in the Action window. Once dressed, access the Character menu to see the insulation and defense your worn clothing provides in the top left of the Character window.
Gather wood by attacking trees or bushes. Once you have the ingredients, access the Inventory and locate Wooden Club in the Basics category of the Crafting window.

In order to hunt for food you will need a ranged weapon. Gather wood, stone, plant fibers and feathers found in bird nests on the ground. Once you have the ingredients, access the Basics category of the Crafting window. Craft a Wooden Bow and Arrow.

Gather small stones and Craft a Campfire from the Basics category of the Crafting window. Equip the Campfire and place it in the world using the secondary action. Once placed you can use the campfire to warm yourself or cook.

To craft a bellows you will need to harvest animal hide, gather wood, and a short metal pipe. Once you have the ingredients, access the Inventory and locate the Resources category of the Crafting window.

To Craft a forge you will need to gather small rocks, clay lumps, a short metal pipe and combine them with a Bellows and can be found in the Basics category of the Crafting window. Once placed you can use the forge to smelt resources to craft more advanced equipent.
To build a Workbench you will need to gather wood, nails and glue. Once you have the ingredients, access the Inventory and locate the Building category of the Crafting window.

Gather wood and craft Wooden Frames from the Basics category of the Crafting window in your workbench. Place Wooden Frames in the world by equipping them and using the secondary action. Upgrade them with a Stone Axe using the secondary action while you have extra wood in your Inventory.

To build a Tailoring Table you will need to gather a claw hammer, wood, nails and glue. Once you have the ingredients, access the Inventory of your workbench, place the claw hammer in an empty tools slot and locate the Building category of the Crafting window.

To craft a Sewing Machine you will need to first craft forged iron and gather springs, mechanical and electric parts from dissassembling appliances, Once you have the ingredients, access your Workbench and navigate to the Tools recipe category, highlight the recipe and click the craft button.
Place the Sewing Machine into the tools slot of your Tailoring Table. Once placed you will be able to craft a important survival equipment like a bedroll or more advanced clothing and armor.

Craft a Bedroll by gathering cotton and crafting cloth from the cotton you have gathered, dont forget to leave extra for stuffing. Once you have the ingredients access your Tailoring Table and navigate to the Basics recipe category, highlight the recipe and click the craft button.
Place the Bedroll in the world by first equipping it and using the secondary action key. Once placed you'll see a Bed Icon on your compass and map. This will lead you back to your home and will act as a re-spawn point if you die.

To Craft a smithing table gather or craft forged iron, once you have the ingredients access your workbench and navigate to the Building category, highlight the recipe and click the craft button. You must occupy the workbench while this completes to recieve credit.

Craft animal hide clothing to protect you from damage and keep you warm in cold weather. Gather animal hide from harvesting animals. Once you have the ingredients, access the Tailoring Table and locate the Clothing category of the Crafting window.

To wear your animal hide armor, access the Inventory and select an article of clothing, then select Wear in the Action window. Once dressed, access the Character menu to see the insulation and defense your worn clothing provides in the top left of the Character window.

To craft leather armor you will need to first gather leather or craft it from animal hide. Once you have the ingredients, access the Tailoring Table and locate the Clothing category of the Crafting window.

To wear your leather armor, access the Inventory and select an article of clothing, then select Wear in the Action window. Once dressed, access the Character menu to see the insulation and defense your worn clothing provides in the top left of the Character window.
To craft scrap armor you will need to first gather scrap iron. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Clothing category of the Crafting window.

To wear your scrap armor, access the Inventory and select an article of clothing, then select Wear in the Action window. Once dressed, access the Character menu to see the insulation and defense your worn clothing provides in the top left of the Character window.

To craft military armor you will need to first gather or craft military fibers, you can craft military fibers with leather and cloth at the Tailoring Table and is considered a leatherworking skill. Once you have the ingredients, access the Tailoring Table and locate the Clothing category of the Crafting window.

To wear your military armor, access the Inventory and select an article of clothing, then select Wear in the Action window. Once dressed, access the Character menu to see the insulation and defense your worn clothing provides in the top left of the Character window.
To craft iron armor you will need to first gather or craft forged iron. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Clothing category of the Crafting window.

To wear your iron armor, access the Inventory and select an article of clothing, then select Wear in the Action window. Once dressed, access the Character menu to see the insulation and defense your worn clothing provides in the top left of the Character window.
To craft an iron club you will need to first gather wood and forged iron. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Weapons category of the Crafting window.
To craft a barbed club you will need to first gather wood and barbed wire. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Weapons category of the Crafting window.
To craft an spiked club you will need to first gather wood, barbed wire and nails. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Weapons category of the Crafting window.
To craft a Sledgehammer you will need to first gather wood and forged iron. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Weapons category of the Crafting window.
To craft a Hunting Knife you will need to first gather wood and forged iron. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Weapons category of the Crafting window.

To craft a Machete you will need to first gather forged steel, wood, leather and duct tape. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Weapons category of the Crafting window.
To craft a Steel Shovel you will need to first gather wood and forged steel. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Weapons category of the Crafting window.
To craft a Steel Pickaxe you will need to first gather wood and forged steel. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Weapons category of the Crafting window.
To craft a Steel Fireaxe you will need to first gather wood and forged steel. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and locate the Weapons category of the Crafting window.

To craft a small engine you must gather or craft an airfilter, radiator, forged iron, springs and mechanical parts. Once you have the ingredients, access the workbench and locate the Resources category of the Crafting window.

To craft a Crossbow and Bolt gather wood, forged iron, leather, glue, duct tape, a feather and an iron arrow head. Once you have the ingredients, access the Smithing Table and navigate to the Weapons category of the Crafting window.

To assemble a Weapon or Motorized Tool or upgrade it with better parts you must have all the parts in your inventory and have unlocked the recipe. Build it by selecting the part in your inventory and clicking on the “Assemble” action. These recipes will not appear in Crafting menus.

To assemble a Weapon or Motorized Tool or upgrade it with better parts you must have all the parts in your inventory and have unlocked the recipe. Build it by selecting the part in your inventory and clicking on the “Assemble” action. These recipes will not appear in Crafting menus.

Kill 50 zombies with a wooden club.
Kill 50 zombies with a iron club.
Kill 50 zombies with a barbed club.
Kill 50 zombies with a sledgehammer.
Kill 50 zombies with a spiked club.
Kill 50 zombies with a hunting knife.
Kill 50 zombies with a machete.
Kill 50 zombies with a pistol.
Kill 50 zombies with a smg.
Kill 50 zombies with a sawed-off Shotgun.
Kill 50 zombies with a Pump Shotgun.
Kill 50 zombies with a Magnum.
Kill 50 zombies with a Hunting Rifle.
Kill 50 zombies with a Ak47.
Kill 50 zombies with a Sniper Rifle.
Kill 50 zombies with a Rocket Launcher.
Kill 50 zombies with a wooden bow.
Kill 50 zombies with a compound bow.
Kill 50 zombies with a crossbow.

Global Warning! The C.D.C. is officially announcing a world wide epidemic! The Scientists at the C.D.C. have released this statement, An unknown virus has swept over the world overnight, we suspect a possible biological terrorist attack, although the origins of the virus are unknown, what we do know is that there is no cure, it has a 100% mortality rate and the bodies of the deceased are returning to life, driven by an unknown force that induces a bloodthirsty rage. We are beyond help and we are beyond hope!
quest.offer_key: Global Warning! The C.D.C. is officially announcing a world wide epidemic! The Scientists at the C.D.C. have released this statement, An unknown virus has swept over the world overnight, we suspect a possible biological terrorist attack, although the origins of the virus are unknown, what we do know is that there is no cure, it has a 100% mortality rate and the bodies of the deceased are returning to life, driven by an unknown force that induces a bloodthirsty rage. We are beyond help and we are beyond hope!

quest.description_key: The merciful killings.
It becomes easier with time
Emotionally numb, you no longer stop to think about your actions and accept your fate.
There may be some hope left after all. Kill Them All!
